Description: Body sherd of probably Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; faint cream slip; exterior: black-figure (fired red) decoration consisting of horse to right (lower part of neck with mane and forelegs).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see Boardman (1998), p. 171, fig. 348.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 136, no. 3)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 87, pl. X, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.111) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
